byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and Dan Levin from Beijing.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and DAN LEVIN

abstract: United States officials issue warning to China about Chinese operatives on US soil seeking to repatriate Chinese citizens, some of whom are wanted in country's crackdown on corruption; warning is indication of growing anger in Obama administration toward Chinese government on range of issues and comes just before September visit to US by Pres Xi Jinping.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has warned Beijing about the presence of Chinese government agents operating secretly in the United States to pressure prominent expatriates to return home immediately, according to American officials.

headline.main: Obama Administration Warns Beijing About Covert Agents Operating in U.S.
headline.print_headline: China Is Warned Over Its Agents on American Soil

snippet: The Obama administration has warned Beijing about the presence of Chinese government agents operating secretly in the United States to pressure prominent expatriates to return home immediately, according to American officials.

keywords.value: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China
keywords.name: organizations
